intro: Piaranthus pillansii var. inconstans, commonly known as the variable pearlplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its distinctive adaptations to arid environments. This species is relatively rare and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
